title: The Economic case for a Space Critical Infrastructure model
summary: The utility of space-based services and information is beyond reproach, as reflected in the increasing demand for space services on the part of Earthlings. So great is the demand that […]

title: Chris Moran, Lockheed Martin Ventures – Commercial Space Transformers
summary: In this episode of Commercial Space Transformers SpaceNews Senior Staff Writer Jason Rainbow speaks with Chris Moran, Vice President and General Manager, Lockheed Martin Ventures (LMV). LMV is Lockheed Martin's Venture Capital arm and about a third of its portfolio is invested in space. Some of its most notable space Investments include launchers Rocket Lab and ABL Space.

title: Gateway: Life in a Lunar Module
summary: Teams at NASA, ESA (European Space Agency), and Thales Alenia Space, including astronauts Stan Love and Luca Parmitano, came together in Turin, Italy, this summer for a test run of Gateway, humanity’s first space station to orbit the Moon. The group conducted what is known as human factors testing inside a mockup of Lunar I-Hab, […]

title: Space Force refining commercial backup plan for military satellites
summary: The Commercial Augmentation Space Reserve would allow the military to tap into commercial space assets, such as satellites and communication systems, during crises or emergencies.

title: Foust Forward | Elon Musk, SpaceX and the perils of social media distractions

title: Venus atmosphere sample return noted in China’s long-term space science roadmap
summary: HELSINKI — China has unveiled a long-term roadmap to guide its space science programs up to 2050, including a mission to collect a sample of the Venusian atmosphere. The Chinese […]

title: NASA on track to decide new approach for MSR by end of year
summary: NASA officials say the agency is on track to decide by the end of the year how to revise the Mars Sample Return (MSR) architecture to lower its costs and shorten its schedule.

title: Space Force to increase spending on low Earth orbit satellite services
summary: The Proliferated Low Earth Orbit satellite services program, launched in 2023, has already used $660 million of its allocated $900 million budget in just over a year

title: Proteus and SAIC form strategic partnership
summary: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. – Los Angeles startup Proteus Space announced a strategic partnership Oct. 22 with government contractor SAIC. In addition, SAIC made a “significant investment” in the startup. The […]

title: CNES to Flight Test Early Prototype of a European Spacesuit
summary: The French space agency CNES has published a call for the development, manufacture, and flight testing of an early prototype of a European intravehicular activity (IVA) spacesuit. Between late 2023 and early 2024, Spartan Space, the Institute of Space Medicine and Physiology (MEDES), and the sporting goods retailer Decathlon were contracted by CNES to complete […]
